tutorial.speak:
Once a member logs in, there are a number of additional options that may appear in the member portal.
The first is the My Groups option. This will show a list of all groups at your church the member belongs to in the right column. Along with a timeline of events and posts from those groups.
Group membership is managed from the Groups section of Chums.
Back in B1, users can click on their groups to see events, conversations, members and other group info.
The next option is Check In, which allows users to automatically mark themselves as in attendance to groups.
This will show up if you've configured services and groups in Chums.
Like with Giving, detailed reports are avaialable for all check-ins.
We covered Donate in the anonymous video, but when users are logged in they have additional option such as giving history and the ability to manage recurring donations and payment methods.
The member directory is a very popular option which is only available to members and staff, not visitors.
Click on any member to see their contact info and family members. You can message them directly from the app by clicking the Message button.
Members are managed from the People tab of Chums.
If you wish to give members the option to manage their own information, you can enable this by setting a directory approval group in the Chums settings.
Once this is set, members will see a new Modify Profile option on their own profile where they can update their own information.
These change requests must be approved by the group you selected before they will show up. This is to prevent abuse.
Plans are used to allow users to respond to volunteer requests.
These show up for any users who are a part of a volunteer team. These teams are configured in the Plans section of Chums.
The lessons tab provides a guide for your teachers to lead lessons or for students to review them.
This is an integration with Lessons.church which has hundreds of high quality lessons available for free.
This tab will show up if you are a member of the volunteer team or parent or student group for any classroom in lessons.church.
The last two options that show up automatically are based on your permissions. People marked as staff members will see a link to Chums and those with content admin permissions will see an admin link.
